pages.text: You may notice that there's something new influencing injection rates. A particular string of numbers mentioned by various sources that is very confusing, bewildering even.$(br2)As the author of this journal, it's my job to help you out.

Each number in a gem's listed array corresponds to a specific type of value. Reading the numbers from left to right, the values are as follows:$(br)$(li)Organic$(li)Mystical$(li)Crystalline$(li)Metallic$(li)Igneous$(li)Moisture

Every block has its own value that contributes to a gem's potential emergence.$(br2)Some blocks are very crystalline or mystical in nature, while others may be soggy wet or organic like moss.$(br2)Your injection site plays a huge part in what your gem results will be.

Something else you may be asking yourself is, 'what the hell is an injection trigger item?'$(br2)It's an item you can put into an injector to influence a gem's emergence even further. For example, a magma block for Ruby.$(br2)This will never guarantee a gem to pop out from the ground, however.
